result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Activity:  Initial appearance

04:19 PM Defendant Marquise Davelle Clark in court in custody by video from the Rock County Jail with attorney Jason D Sanders by video.  Gerald Anthony Urbik appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Address and date of birth verified. Court sets $3500 cash bond with conditions:  No contact directly or indirectly with victim L.D., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. Must remain in residence between the hours of 6pm and 6am unless at work or traveling to and from work.  Court orders Level 4 upervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody. GPS monitoring if released. Preliminary hearing requested by zoom. Preliminary Hearing scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 10:00 AM.
